verses.roman:
rājāra mūla-dhana diyā ye kichu labhya haya
sei dhana kariha nānā dharme-karme vyaya

synonyms: rājāra—of the King; mūla-dhana—revenue; diyā—after paying; ye kichu labhya haya—whatever is obtained; sei—that; dhana—money; kariha nānā dharme-karme vyaya—spend in various types of religious and fruitive activities.
translation: "First you should pay the revenue due the King, and then you may spend the balance for religious and fruitive activities.
